doTopik_1.txt2: Foreign students who lack basic Korean language skills in their studies and daily lives are likely to have difficulty in studying in Korea.
doTopik_1.txt3: The Korean government requires foreign students to have a certain level of Korean proficiency to improve the quality of studying in Korea.
doTopik_1.txt4: Therefore, in order to be admitted to a Korean university, you need to take the Korean Language Proficiency Test (TOPIK) score from the National Institute of International Education.
doTopik_1.txt7: Providing Korean language learning directions for overseas Koreans and foreigners who do not speak Korean as their native language and expanding Korean language dissemination
doTopik_1.txt8: By measuring and evaluating Korean language proficiency, the results can be used for studying abroad at a university or for employment.
doTopik_1.txt10: Overseas Koreans and foreigners who do not speak Korean as their native language
doTopik_1.txt11: Korean language learners and applicants to Korean universities
doTopik_1.txt12: Overseas Koreans who have attended or graduated from a foreign school
doTopik_1.txt14: Valid for 2 years from the date of the announcement of grades
doTopik_1.txt18: Government-sponsored foreign scholarship and academic management
doTopik_1.txt19: Foreigners and 12-year foreign curriculum students enrolled in Korean universities and graduate schools
doTopik_1.txt20: Acquisition and selection of employment visa for Korean companies seeking employment, HR standards
doTopik_1.txt21: Recognition of domestic licenses of foreign medical personnel
doTopik_1.txt22: Documents to support the qualification examination of foreign Korean language teachers (National Language Institute)
doTopik_1.txt25:
It is held six times a year (January, March, April, July, October and November).

(Please check the specific test schedule on the Korean Proficiency Test (TOPIK) website at the beginning of the year)
doTopik_1.txt28:
TOPIKⅡ for intermediate and advanced students (Level 3~6)

(Depending on the test score, the evaluation grade is determined within the test taken.)
